page.title: 13GOXHILL PRIMARY SCHOOL.
page.content: The school moved into its present building in two stages - the Juniors in September 1975 and the Infants the following Easter. There are almost 200 children on role in three Junior and three Infant classes which are preceded by a nursery class with children from three and a half years of age. Most children go on to Baysgarth Comprehensive School in Barton for their secondary education. Thornton Curtis, Burnham and Goxhill Marsh children come to school daily by bus. There are 8 classrooms, 4 each on opposite sides of a central hall. The eighth classroom is used as a school library and resources room. The school has its own playing fields and kitchen to cook school meals. Over half the children have a school meal costing 60 p., a few go home and slightly less than half bring a packed lunch.
